events.name: Guide to iOS Apps Programming 1
events.description:
This workshops introduces the participants to the basics of developing apps in iOS environment. You will learn the fundamentals of app design and logic. As well as understanding more about functions, structures and data needed to write simple apps. All participants are required to bring their own MacBook and iPhone to make the workshop a meaningful experience. 
  
  
This workshop, together with 4 other workshops including  Guide to Android Apps Programming, Guide to iOS Apps Programming 2, Working With Data and Learn to write a WordPress/Rezkii plugin with web services are pre-workshops that lead up to the actual *hackathon day.  
  
*Participants' for this workshop are not required to attend the hackathon, but if you want to, here's where you sign up: Mosque Tech Challenge 
  
On the day of the workshop, do look out for signages to "The Hive" to find the classroom.  
Contacts: 9760 9715 (Sabri) / 9171 0955 (Hakim)
events.location: Blk K, Level 4 Room K407, , ITE College Central, 2 Ang Mo Kio Drive, Singapore 567720

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Saturday 20th, Sunday 21st and Monday 22nd June 2015 10am to 7pm (Last entry at 6.30pm) ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE SIDM Art Interactive Experience Alumni x Students Experience a selection of vibrant new works from our students and renowned SIDM alumni. It will be a coming-together of creative minds from raw potentials, to established talents in the local IDM and Creative Arts Industry. The first of its kind, this event organized by the School of Interactive & Digital Media will showcase their creative works to industry and public audiences at the prestigious ArtScience Museum.

events.name: DSSG Social Network, Kaggle like a Pro & Dengue Clusters Analysis June Meetup
events.description: *To cater to a larger crowd, we will setup a live stream room at SMU SOE 5-1 (same floor) and online via https://www.periscope.tv/ . Do come early if you want to be in the main room, as we will move people to the live stream room once main room is full. This month, we are excited to have speakers that will share with us insights from their data science projects! Agenda (More details to be announced): • 1pm - 1.15pm: Chat and BYOR (Bring your own refreshments) • 1.15pm - 2pm: Kaggle Otto Challenge - How we achieved 85th out of 3,514 and what we learnt by Eugene Yan & Wang Weimin. Synopsis: Kaggle is an online predictive model competition platform with more than 300k members and counting. For this talk, two of our members will share their experience in one of the most population Kaggle competitions and what they learnt. • 2.15pm - 3pm: DataScience SG social network analysis by Michael Ng • 3pm - 3.20pm: Association Rules on Dengue Locations by Rufeng Xie. Visualization: http://outbreak.sgcharts.com/ Rufeng will talk about his experience in mining association rules from historical dengue data in Singapore. He will investigate both the geospatial and temporal relationships in his analysis. • 3.20pm - 3.30pm: Closing and networking Linkedin Profile: • Michael: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=39150404 • Eugene: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=100188469 • Wang Weimin: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=87948135 • Rufeng Xie: Computer Science masters student at NUS.
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), 90 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.name: Guide to iOS Apps Programming 2
events.description:
This workshop aims to enable participants who wants to develop apps in iOS environment to further understand more advanced features such as reading json files, displaying of data in a table view, utilising the camera, play audio and local notifications. All participants are required to bring their own MacBook and iPhone to make the workshop a meaningful experience. 
  
  
  
This workshop, together with 4 other workshops including  Guide to Android Apps Programming , Guide to iOS Apps Programming 1, Working With Data and Learn to write a WordPress/Rezkii plugin with web services are pre-workshops that lead up to the actual *hackathon day.  
  
*Participants' for this workshop are not required to attend the hackathon, but if you want to, here's where you sign up: Mosque Tech Challenge 
  
On the day of the workshop, do look out for signages to "The Hive" to find the classroom.  
Contacts: 9760 9715 (Sabri) / 9171 0955 (Hakim)
